title: Torque and alpha - force F0 changes to 3F0

content.question: Two concentric disks of different radii are rigidly attached, as shown in the figure. Each disk has a string wrapped around it, and the two downward forces shown are exerted on the strings. The resulting angular acceleration has a magnitude <math alttext="alpha sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. If the force <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> exerted on the larger disk’s string is replaced with a downward force of magnitude <math alttext="3 F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, what is the magnitude of the resulting angular acceleration?
